title: Oklahoma man, 80, 'shot his wife, 77, because she had dementia and he couldn't care for her anymore'
text:
An 80-year-old man allegedly shot and killed his wife of 50 years because she had dementia and he couldn't care for her anymore.

Dorothy Davis initially survived after being shot by Royce Davis, but later died at an Oklahoma hospital. Royce Davis has been charged with first-degree murder.

Police said Royce called 911 just after 3am on Monday to report the crime, and he had planned to kill himself but police negotiated with him to put the gun down.

Authorities found Dorothy on the bed in the couple's Midwest City home with a gunshot wound to the head.

'When he shot his wife, it didn't kill her immediately,' police Chief Brandon Clabes said. 'She was still breathing. He was concerned about her welfare.'

Royce Davis allegedly shot and killed his wife of 50 years because she had dementia and he couldn't care for her anymore

Dorothy Davis, 77, was found lying in her bed in this Midwest City home with a gunshot wound to her head

Davis told dispatchers that his wife was suffering from Alzheimer's disease and dementia, for several years.

He also told police that she didn't recognize him anymore, KOCO reported. They were married for more than 50 years.

'He couldn't take care of her any longer, and he just shot and killed her. And he was going to do the same to himself,' Clabes said.

Ultimately, police negotiated with Davis over the phone to put the gun down before he did more damage, KOCO reported.

Authorities arrived at the home at 3am on Monday, and an ambulance transported Dorothy Davis to an Oklahoma hospital where she later died

Davis was transported to the Oklahoma County Jail.

Neighbors said they were shocked when they heard about the crime.

Ruben Ramos said the couple would sit on their porch together, holding hands.

'So, they looked like that happy-ending couple.'

Another neighbor, Diana Logan, said: 'I'd never fathomed in my wildest dreams that it was like this.'
description: Dorothy Davis, 77, suffering from dementia, allegedly was killed by husband Royce Davis, 80. He confessed to the crime and explained his rationale. He is charged with first-degree murder.
